# type

**Instance Property**

The underlying type of the column.

## Declaration

```swift
var type: MLDataValue.ValueType { get }
```

## Discussion

Use this to determine the underlying type of the column. Then use a corresponding property or method to create an [doc://com.apple.createml/documentation/CreateML/MLDataColumn] of the untyped column. For example, if [doc://com.apple.createml/documentation/CreateML/MLUntypedColumn/type] is equal to [doc://com.apple.createml/documentation/CreateML/MLDataValue/ValueType/double], then use the [doc://com.apple.createml/documentation/CreateML/MLUntypedColumn] [doc://com.apple.createml/documentation/CreateML/MLUntypedColumn/doubles] property.

## Exposing the underlying type to generate a data column

- **ints**: A cloned data column of integers.
- **doubles**: A cloned data column of doubles.
- **strings**: A cloned data column of strings.
- **sequences**: A cloned data column of machine learning sequences.
- **dictionaries**: A cloned data column of machine learning dictionaries.
- **multiArrays**: A cloned data column of machine learning multi-arrays.
- **column(type:)**: Clones the column to a data column of the given type.
